phrases.text: Start by tuning into that little voice in your head. That voice going around in circles, trying to find answers.
Am I doing it right? What if I'm wrong?
Tune into that voice that's always chattering inside.
And slowly visualize it moving down your spine. Getting more and more distant. Getting quieter and quieter.
Moving all the way down to the base of your spine.
Lock in that position. Imagine you can breathe, inspire and expire air from there.
We're going to do three grounding breathing cycles. Imagine you can breathe directly from this point, as if your breath starts right there.
From the base of your spine, inhale for six seconds.
Breathe normally. Getting out of your head, into your body.
Second cycle. Inhale from the base.
Taking up more space inside.
Third and final cycle. Inhale.
You're now grounded at the base of your spine. Connected to your inner world.
Now. Before we go further, I want you to find the feeling that is the hardest place to go for you right now.
Not just an emotion. Something deeper. A state of being that feels unbearable. That thing your mind avoids.
Don't analyze it. Don't think about it intellectually. Just listen to the energy of it in your body. See what it activates.
Shift your awareness now to the sensations that come up around being you.
Welcome the sensations. How does it feel being you?
Do you love being you, the person you are, the life you live?
Welcome any and all sensations. How does it feel being you?
What comes up when you see yourself in this present moment?
Do you love yourself? Do you accept yourself? Are you proud of yourself?
Is there a part of you resisting?
Breathe into these sensations.
Let's go deeper. How do you feel about yourself now, and in the past?
Those younger versions of you.
What versions of yourself do you resist the most? The younger versions you might even hate.
Those versions that ruined everything. If only I didn't say that, if only I did that, my life would be different.
Why? Why did I? I should have known better.
What versions of you seem unforgivable?
Bring them into your awareness. Those versions that didn't know better. That made mistakes.
Visualize them in front of you.
How do you feel seeing them? What do you want to tell them?
Can you forgive them? Entirely?
Haven't you resisted them long enough? Can you welcome them back?
Those versions are you. Welcome the sensations. Let's do a breathing cycle.
Any resistance to forgiving them? Tune into the sensations and inhale.
Let it go.
Breathe normally.
What fears run you and hold you back in life?
The fear of not being good enough. What comes up?
What if I'm not good enough? What if there's something wrong with me?
What if I don't have what it takes?
Allow yourself to feel the sensations.
The fear of being alone. What comes up?
What if no one truly sees me? If I'm destined to be alone, never able to connect without putting up a mask?
What if no one ever gets the real me?
The fear of being stuck. Never living up to your potential. Staying stuck.
Or the fear of being toxic. Did you leave a positive impact on the people you've met?
Can you let go of these fears? Is there any resistance?
Tune into the sensations.
Let's do a cycle. Tune in and inhale.
Let's go one last layer deeper.
Can you let go of the past? Let go of the old you?
Can you turn the page and start a new chapter?
Visualize the old you, that version keeping you stuck. What got you here won't get you there.
Can you thank it? Thank you for getting me this far. But I don't need you anymore.
Thank you, but it's time to say goodbye.
Can you let go of it? The old you. The patterns. The habits.
Can you let go?
What's scary about turning the page?
And what does that look like? Sink into this.
What if things went amazingly well? Tomorrow, next year, the next five years?
What does your life look like? Who are you? How do you feel?
Can you embody this now? Is there any resistance?
Welcome the sensations.
Let's do our biggest breath. Inhale.
Let it all go.
Take a moment to let things slow down.
Let your body relax. Your shoulders.
Detach your tongue from the roof of your mouth. Let your jaw relax.
See how light you can get.
Let your body melt.
Let go of all tension. Your shoulders. Your stomach. Let it melt.
Relax every part of you.
Can you relax even more? Just letting go.
Feeling lighter and lighter. So light you're floating.
Higher and higher. Beyond the mind. Beyond the body.
Letting go completely.
Can you let go even more?
Let yourself melt. Stop controlling.
Just let go.
Floating up so high now. Into this space that comes before everything.
This space of peace. Of abundance. Of authenticity.
Where all is good. All is well.
Where you're exactly where you need to be. Who you need to be.
Where you don't have to impress. You can just be.
This place of ultimate belonging.
Merge with this space. Become one with it.
With every inhale, filling your body with light. Warmth. Love.
Become one with this space. Reconnect.
Feel your body glowing with light. Filled with warmth. Reconnected to love.
Now, gently, from this space of peace...
Bring your attention back to the base of your spine.
Feel this grounding. This connection to the earth.
Start bringing awareness back into your body.
Feel your feet. Their weight. Their warmth.
Feel your legs. Heavy. Relaxed.
Bring awareness into your belly. Your chest. Feel your heart.
Feel your arms. Your hands. The tips of your fingers.
Bring awareness into your neck. Your face.
Feel the top of your head.
Your whole body is now present. Unified. Grounded.
Shift your awareness now. Tonight, your unconscious sent you a message.
Not in words. Not in logic. In images. In sensations. In a language your mind can't fully control.
Your body already knows what this dream is about. Your mind is just catching up.
Now scan your body. Your spine. Is it wanting to curl into a ball? To protect itself with rigidity? Or wanting to stand tall and fight?
Notice your hands. Your fingers. Are they limp? Tingling? Clenched?
Scan your chest. Is there a hot or a cold? A heavy, a light, or a tight feeling?
Your stomach. Your guts. Are they locking up? Is there pain? Hunger? Blankness?
Your jaw. Move it gently, left and right. Is there tension? Sometimes it creeps from the hinge up into the inner ear.

Wherever you've noticed these feelings the most, stay there. Don't judge them as good or bad. Even if they're overwhelming or upsetting. Just turn a curiosity towards them. A kind of wonder of what these things are and what they want.
This is where we're going today.
Your dream showed you running. Something was closing in. Your body chose flight. The oldest program there is.
Don't try to understand why. Just feel what your legs are doing right now. Your hips. Your lower back.
Is there tension? A readiness? Like some part of you is still bracing to sprint?
Stay curious. Don't judge it. This is your body doing something it learned a long time ago.
Now I want you to amplify it. Whatever you feel in your legs, make it bigger. Feel the urgency more. The need to run. The thing behind you getting closer.
If there's fear, feel the fear. Don't be scared to feel it. It's not going to consume you. You're observing it.
What does this fear look like? If you gave it a color, what would it be? A texture? Like static, or mud, or something electric?
And if you listen closely, is there a sound? A hum? A rushing? Words? Just notice what comes. Don't filter it.
Now notice: there's a part of you that wants to protect you from this feeling. A part that says, this is too much, we need to get out of here.
Thank that part. It's been keeping you alive. But right now, you're here to listen. And it's not going to overpower you.
Let that protective part relax. Just a little.
Let's breathe. Inhale into wherever the running lives.
Now let the sensation spread. If it wants to move somewhere else in your body, let it. If it wants to move your body, let it. Don't control this.
Notice if the energy has shifted. A different character. A tiredness. A dull ache. Little involuntary twitches. Any of that is fine.
Something moved. Something is different. Don't try to name it. Just feel what's different from when we started.
One final breath. Inhale.
Your dream showed you frozen. Unable to move. Unable to speak. The body shut down. Went silent. Played dead.
This is the freeze response. When you can't fight and you can't run, the body locks. It's one of the oldest survival programs.
Where do you feel that right now? Your throat? Your jaw? Your shoulders? Your whole body? Scan and find where it's the most intense.
Stay with it. I know your instinct is to pull away. To make it stop. But stay.
Now amplify it. Make the freeze bigger. Feel what it's like to be completely locked. Completely voiceless. Unable to act.
If this frozen feeling had a temperature, what would it be? Ice cold? Or strangely hot? Is it dense like metal or numb like nothing?
If it had a visual, what would you see? A block of ice? An empty room? Darkness? Just let an image come.
And a sound. Is there silence? A ringing? A muffled voice that can't get out?
This part of you that freezes — it thinks this is all you are and all you can do. It thinks the danger is still here.
Don't argue with it. Have empathy for it. It thinks what it's doing is necessary. And for a long time, it was.
Now notice the other parts. The ones that say, it's not real anymore, you're safe. Thank them for their protection. And let them relax too. You're here to listen.
Let's breathe into the place that's the most frozen. Inhale.
Now let the sensation do what it wants. If it wants to spread, let it. If it wants to move your body, even slightly, let it.
Notice if the energy has changed. If the character is different. Warmer. Looser. Tingling. Or maybe just tired, the way chronic tension feels when it starts to resolve.
Wiggle your fingers. Just tiny movements. Notice that you can.
Something shifted. You don't have to understand it. Just notice that it's different.
Your dream showed you falling. The ground gone. Nothing underneath.
Where do you feel that right now? Your belly? Your solar plexus? That dropping sensation? Find it.
Stay there. Don't rush to ground yourself. I want you to feel the falling.
Now amplify it. Feel the emptiness beneath you getting bigger. The vertigo. The absence of anything solid. Make it more vivid.
If you're scared, feel the fear. Don't be scared of the fear. It's energy. It's information. It's your body telling you something.
What does this falling look like? Are you in darkness? In open space? In a void? Get curious about the space around you.
Is there a sound? Wind? Silence? Your own heartbeat?
And the sensation itself — is it in your stomach like a drop on a rollercoaster? Or is it more diffuse, like the ground under everything is unstable?
If you can, give it a texture. Empty like a dry well? Churning like water? Imploding?
Notice the parts of you that want to grab onto something. The parts that say: find the ground, find control, hold on. Thank them. They're trying to protect you. Let them know you're just listening.
Let's breathe. Hands on your belly. Inhale slowly.
Long exhale. Twice as long.
Again. Inhale.
Now let the sensation settle wherever it wants to go. Has it moved? Changed? Connected to something else you hadn't noticed?
Feel the surface beneath you now. The weight. The pressure. Notice what's different from when we started. That's enough.
Your dream showed you in conflict. Fighting. Arguing. Defending yourself. Raw energy with nowhere to go.
Where is the anger right now? Your jaw? Your fists? Your chest? The back of your neck? Find where it lives.
Don't try to soften it. Don't try to make it reasonable. I want you to feel it fully.
Now amplify it. Make the anger bigger. Feel the energy that wanted to explode. The words that wanted to be screamed. The fist that wanted to hit.
Don't be scared of this. Anger is not destruction. It's power. It's the energy of a boundary being crossed. Of something mattering.
What does this anger look like? Red? Electric? Like fire? Like a wall? Give it a form.
Is there a sound? A roar? A growl? Words you never said? Let them exist without censorship.
Your body wants to do something with this energy. Stand taller? Make yourself bigger? Clench harder? Let it do what it wants for a moment.
This anger was locked away because at some point you learned it wasn't safe. That it was bad. That you were bad for feeling it.
The part that locked it away was protecting you. Thank it. But you're here now, and you're strong enough to hold this energy without it possessing you.
Let's breathe. Inhale into where the anger burns the hottest.
Now let the energy move. Where does it want to go? Does it spread? Does it transform? What's the character of it now?
Is it still rage? Or has it shifted into something else? Tiredness? Grief? Sometimes anger is the shell around something softer.
Whatever you're feeling now, just notice it. Notice what's different. That's all we need.
Your dream carried the weight of loss. Someone gone. Something missing. An absence your body still holds.
Where is the grief? Your chest? Behind your sternum? Your throat? Find where your body closes when this feeling comes.
Stay there. I know it's heavy. I know there's a part of you that wants to wall it off. That's been walling it off for a long time.
Instead of pulling away, go deeper. Amplify the ache. Feel the weight of the absence. The space where something used to be.
What does this loss look like? Is it darkness? Emptiness? A room with someone missing? Let an image come.
Is there a sound? Silence? An echo? A voice you miss?
And the sensation itself. Is it heavy like stone? Cold? Or just... hollow? Like a space that was carved out and never filled?
The walls you built around your heart were intelligent. They kept the worst of the pain out. But they also kept everything else out.
Notice the protective parts that say: don't go here, it's too much, you'll fall apart. Thank them. They kept you functioning. But you're strong enough to feel this now.
If emotion comes, let it. If tears come, let them. This is not breaking down. This is your body doing what it couldn't do before.
Let's breathe into the ache. Inhale.
Now let the sensation do what it wants. Has it moved? Spread? Changed character? Connected to another feeling you hadn't noticed?
Something is different in your chest. Even slightly. The grief isn't fixed. It's still there. But you looked at it. You stayed. And that changes the relationship.
Your dream showed you exposed. Seen in a way you didn't want to be seen. Stripped of your mask.
Where do you feel that? A flush in your face? A sinking in your belly? A pull to disappear, to make yourself smaller? Find the place that's the most intense.
I know every part of you wants to run from this. That's what shame does. It makes you want to vanish.
But instead of running, we're going to do the hardest thing. We're going to stay. And we're going to feel more.
Amplify it. Feel the exposure getting bigger. The eyes on you. The judgment. The wrongness. Make it more vivid.
If this shame had a color, what would it be? If it had a texture, like slime, or burning, or a weight? Don't think. Just let it come.
Is there a sound? A voice? What is it saying? Let the words come even if they're ugly.
If this feeling had an age, how old would it be? Don't think. Just let a number come.
This is old. This is the root. A moment when a younger version of you learned that something about them was wrong. Unacceptable. Shameful.
That younger you — they didn't have the resources to process this. They just locked it away. That was survival.
Notice the protective parts that built an entire personality around never being exposed again. Thank them. They did an incredible job. But you're here now.
Let's breathe into the shame. Right into the center of it. Inhale.
Now let the sensation do what it wants. Has it moved? Changed? Is the character different? A tiredness? A softness? Even a strange relief?
You stayed. You looked at the thing you've been hiding from. You didn't disappear. Something shifted. Just notice what's different.
This dream keeps coming back. The same scenario. The same feeling. Your unconscious is stuck in a loop. It's trying to complete something that was never finished.
Where does this dream live in your body? You know the place. It's always the same zone. Find it.
Stay there. Amplify it. Feel the loop tightening. The frustration of being stuck in the same place, again and again.
What does the stuck feeling look like? A wall? A locked door? Quicksand? An image that doesn't make logical sense?
Is there a sound? A repeating phrase? Static? Something that loops like the dream itself?
Your nervous system isn't broken. It's a ball of yarn with tangled threads. Different types of memory, all knotted together, activating the same pattern over and over.
Let's go into the dream. Not to relive it. To observe it like a movie you've seen too many times. See the scene. The characters. Find the exact moment where it gets stuck.
Now. Here's where it changes.
In the dream, there was something you couldn't do. You couldn't run. Couldn't speak. Couldn't open the door. Couldn't reach the person.
This time, in your mind, do it. Complete the action. Whatever your body wanted to do, let it happen in your imagination. Don't hold back.
Feel that in your body. What does completion feel like? Where does the grip release?
Let's breathe. Inhale the old stuck version.
Exhale the new ending.
Your body just felt the exit from the loop. Not in your head. In your nervous system. That's different from understanding it. That's the untangling.
The dream may come back. But it won't be the same. Because your body now knows there's a way through.
This dream is different. It doesn't carry pain. It carries a message. Something from the deepest part of you.
Jung called these numinous dreams. Dreams from the Self. The part that exists before the wounds. Before the patterns. Before the masks.
Most people let these dreams fade by lunchtime. Not today. Today we anchor it in your body.
Re-enter the dream. Not as a memory. As an experience. See the images. The light. The space. Let it come back fully.
Where do you feel it in your body? The expansion. The warmth. The openness. Find where it's the strongest.
Now amplify it. Make it bigger. Brighter. More vivid. Whatever you're feeling, feel more of it.
What does it look like? A light? A color? A vast space? An image that doesn't fit into words?
Is there a sound? A tone? Music? A silence that feels full instead of empty?
This feeling is not something you're creating. It's something you're remembering. This is you before the armor.
If there was a presence in this dream, a figure, a light, a feeling — what did it want you to know? Don't think. Listen with your body.
Whatever you received, a feeling, a word, a knowing — place your hands where you feel it the strongest. Breathe it deeper. Into your chest. Your belly. Your limbs.
Let's anchor this. Inhale this feeling fully.
Exhale. Seal it in.
This experience is now a bodily memory. Not a thought. A sensation. When the noise of life pulls you away, come back here. It's always available. In the body.
Take a moment now. Let things slow down.
We've moved some things. Unlocked some things. The energy may have shifted. So let's bring it all back to center.
Scan your body. What's different from when we started? Look for different. Not better or worse. Just different.
Are there places that feel cold or hot? Tight or loose? Pain or release? Whatever it is, if it's different, that's what we want.

We don't have to understand everything that just happened. These things are like balls of yarn. Different types of memory tangled together. We started to untangle. We started to see what's connected to what.
It's still there. The pattern. The feeling. But we saw it. We mapped some of the terrain beneath language. And that changes the relationship.
Now cross your arms across your chest. Rub the texture of your clothing. Feel the contact.
Open your arms wide. Then slowly up over your head like a snow angel.
Point one foot down and reach. Then the other. Stretch.
Wiggle your spine gently, side to side. Then front to back. Let the movement ripple all the way through.
Good. We've moved the somatic energy. Now let everything settle.
Now, gently.
Take a deep breath and feel your body and your sense of consciousness as a whole thing again. Not deconstructed. Back together.
Feel your feet. Their weight. Their warmth.
Feel your legs. Your belly. Your chest. Feel your heart.
Feel your arms. Your hands. The tips of your fingers.
Your neck. Your face. The top of your head.
Your whole body is present. Unified. One thing again.
One final breath.
Now open your eyes slowly. Look at the world around you. Notice that it's different. That you feel different. And different is good.
You don't have to understand everything that happened right now. It's normal for realizations and memories to surface over the next hours and days. Just notice them.
Notice your relationship to this feeling being a different thing now. Notice the small changes. The shoulders that relax. The posture that shifts. Come back to this whenever it's helpful.
Take your time. Have some water if you'd like.
Before coming back, let's take one final grounding breath.
Breathe in deeply.
Exhale slowly.
You did deep work. Be gentle with yourself.
I'm going to count from one to five. At five, open your eyes.
One. Awareness rising.
Two. Sensation in your fingers and toes.
Three. Energy returning.
Four. Almost back.
Five. Open your eyes. Welcome back.
Take your time. Have some water if you'd like.
